title: isFinite
markdown:
# isFinite()

 The **`isFinite()`** function determines whether the passed value is a finite number. If needed, the parameter is first converted to a number.

## [Try it](#try%5Fit)

## [Syntax](#syntax)

```
isFinite(testValue)

```

### [Parameters](#parameters)

`testValue`

The value to be tested for finiteness.

### [Return value](#return%5Fvalue)

**`false`** if the argument is (or will be coerced to) positive or negative [Infinity](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/Infinity) or [NaN](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/NaN) or [undefined](/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global%5FObjects/undefined); otherwise, **`true`**.

## [Description](#description)

`isFinite` is a function property of the global object.

 You can use this function to determine whether a number is a finite number. The`isFinite` function examines the number in its argument. If the argument is`NaN`, positive infinity, or negative infinity, this method returns`false`; otherwise, it returns `true`.

## [Examples](#examples)

### [Using isFinite](#using%5Fisfinite)

```
isFinite(Infinity); // false
isFinite(NaN); // false
isFinite(-Infinity); // false

isFinite(0); // true
isFinite(2e64); // true
isFinite(910); // true

// Would've been false with the more robust Number.isFinite():
isFinite(null); // true
isFinite("0"); // true

```

## [Specifications](#specifications)

| Specification                                                                                                                         |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ECMAScript Language Specification  \# sec-isfinite-number](https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/global-object.html#sec-isfinite-number) |

## [Browser compatibility](#browser%5Fcompatibility)

BCD tables only load in the browser
